text: The 1910–11 NHA season was the second season of the former National Hockey Association. Five teams played 16 games each, starting on December 31, 1910 and ending on March 10, 1911. The Ottawa Hockey Club won the league championship and took over the Stanley Cup from the Montreal Wanderers. ==Regular season== ===Final standings=== National Hockey Association GP W L T GF GA Ottawa Hockey Club 16 13 3 0 122 69 Montreal Canadiens 16 8 8 0 66 62 Renfrew Creamery Kings 16 8 8 0 91 101 Montreal Wanderers 16 7 9 0 73 88 Quebec Bulldogs 16 4 12 0 65 97 Standings: Note: W = Wins, L = Losses, T = Ties, GF = Goals for, GA = Goals against ===Results=== Month Day Visitor Score Home Score Dec. 31 Ottawa 5 Canadiens 3 Jan. 2 Renfrew 2 Quebec 3 Jan. 5† Wanderers 4 Renfrew 2 Jan. 7 Canadiens 4 Quebec 1 Jan. 7 Wanderers 5 Ottawa 10 Jan. 10 Quebec 4 Wanderers 5 (overtime) Jan. 10 Ottawa 5 Renfrew 4 Jan. 14 Renfrew 1 Canadiens 4 Jan. 14 Quebec 5 Ottawa 13 Jan. 16 Quebec 5 Renfrew 10 Jan. 18 Canadiens 4 Wanderers 5 Jan. 21 Canadiens 4 Ottawa 5 (overtime) Jan. 21 Wanderers 5 Quebec 3 Jan. 24 Renfrew 5 Ottawa 19 Jan. 24 Quebec 5 Canadiens 9 Jan. 27 Canadiens 6 Renfrew 5 Jan. 28 Ottawa 8 Wanderers 2 Feb. 1 Renfrew 8 Quebec 7 Feb. 1 Wanderers 6 Canadiens 3 Feb. 3 Wanderers 5 Renfrew 8 Feb. 4 Ottawa 6 Quebec 4 Feb. 7 Canadiens 9 Wanderers 2 Feb. 11 Quebec 2 Canadiens 3 Feb. 11 Wanderers 4 Ottawa 9 Feb. 15‡ Wanderers 4 Renfrew 5 (at Ottawa) Feb. 15 Canadiens 4 Quebec 7 Feb. 18 Renfrew 4 Wanderers 6 Feb. 18 Ottawa 7 Quebec 2 Feb. 21 Renfrew 2 Canadiens 4 Feb. 22 Wanderers 3 Quebec 1 Feb. 24 Ottawa 7 Renfrew 8 Feb. 25 Quebec 3 Wanderers 2 Feb. 27 Quebec 11 Renfrew 10 Feb. 28 Wanderers 2 Canadiens 3 Feb. 28 Quebec 2 Ottawa 6 Mar. 2 Ottawa 7 Wanderers 11 Mar. 2 Canadiens 3 Renfrew 5 Mar. 4 Renfrew 7 Ottawa 6 Mar. 7 Wanderers 6 Renfrew 7 Mar. 8 Ottawa 4 Canadiens 3 Mar. 10 Canadiens 0 Ottawa 5 † Protested by Renfrew. ‡ Replay of protested game. ===Goalkeeper Averages=== Name Club GP GA SO Avg.
